content: I don't have personal experience, but seoul has made efforts to improve the accessibility of public transportation for people with disabilities. the seoul metropolitan government has set up a system to assess the accessibility of public transportation facilities and services, and they have introduced various measures to improve accessibility, including the installation of elevators and wheelchair ramps in subway stations and buses. additionally, some subway cars are designated as "barrier-free cars," which are equipped with priority seating, wheelchair spaces, and accessible toilets. however, there are still some barriers to accessing public transportation for people with disabilities, such as steep stairs and narrow doorways in older subway stations. overall, seoul has made progress in improving the accessibility of public transportation, but there is still room for improvement.
